author: antaranews.com
title: OIC should continue fighting for Palestine's independence: FM Retno - ANTARA News
text: Speaking at the 15th OIC Summit in Banjul, the capital city of the Gambia, on Saturday (May 4), she reminded OIC countries about the consensus that ending occupation over Palestine should be the prerequisite for peace with Israel. "The consensus gives a strong message to Israel that there will be no diplomatic relations without independence for the Palestinians. We should defend the message of the consensus," the minister stated in the Foreign Ministry's statement that ANTARA obtained her Sunday. In response to the ongoing Israeli genocide in the Gaza Strip, which has killed more than 34 thousand Palestinians in the last seven months, she urged the OIC members to unite for justice and humanity for the Palestinian people. The OIC should also toil to ensure a smooth humanitarian aid distribution to the Gaza Strip, which is free from the Israeli hindrance and interference, she added. 'We should ensure humanitarian aid received by Gaza Strip residents and by all available means to continue our support to the UNRWA. Hence, I emphasise the need to implement the Islamic Financial Safety Aid immediately," Retno Marsudi affirmed. She further urged the OIC members to call for an immediate and permanent ceasefire between Israel and the Palestinian resistance movement, Hamas, in the Gaza Strip. "A ceasefire will be a breakthrough to prevent more bloodshed and alleviate the people's suffering. It is also important for realising a conducive environment for a fair negotiation to realise the two-state solution," she stated. The OIC members should also avoid conflict escalation by not being involved in an open conflict and focus on mitigating the humanitarian disaster in Gaza instead. "We should help maintain the regional and global stability. OIC should contribute to the peace instead of aggravating the crisis," she emphasised. The minister's call for unity is conveyed to remind the OIC countries that normalising relations with Israel without addressing the Palestinian issue is a violation of the OIC consensus. Reminding the OIC members about the consensus is important, especially when several members, Bahrain, Egypt, Jordan, Morocco, Sudan, and the United Arab Emirates, have established diplomatic relations with Israel. Meanwhile, Saudi Arabia that earlier opened the possibility of diplomatic ties with Israel, threatened to backtrack from the process if Israel invaded Rafah in southern Gaza, where 1.2 million Palestinians in the region seek refuge from the armed conflict. Related news: [Indonesia, Turkey share same principle on Palestine: FM Marsudi](https://en.antaranews.com/news/312306/indonesia-turkey-share-same-principle-on-palestine-fm-marsudi) Related news: [Indonesia, Saudi Arabia share commitment to support Palestine: VP](https://en.antaranews.com/news/312234/indonesia-saudi-arabia-share-commitment-to-support-palestine-vp) Translator: Yashinta Difa P, Nabil Ihsan Editor: Rahmad Nasution Copyright ¬© ANTARA 2024

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Saguen√©ens Honor 20-Year-Old Players in Celebration Match March 21
text:
Saguen√©ens Honor 20-Year-Old Players in Celebration Match March 21
On March 21, 2025, the Chicoutimi Saguen√©ens will honor their 20-year-old players at the Centre Georges-V√©zina. This annual tradition celebrates the junior careers of F√©lix Gagnon, Kassim Gaudet, and Lo√Øc Usereau with special recognition for their hard work and leadership in the LHJMQ. Each player will be honored alongside family members during the match, highlighting their perseverance and commitment to excellence in hockey.
- F√©lix Gagnon: 59% faceoff win rate in his LHJMQ career.
- Kassim Gaudet: Captain for both the Remparts in 2023-24 and Saguen√©ens in 2024-25.
- The Saguen√©ens have showcased consistent performance, with significant contributions from veteran players.
- Gagnon and Usereau have participated in NHL training camps, demonstrating their potential at the professional level.
The Saguen√©ens aim to build on their successful season by leveraging the experience of their senior players in upcoming matches, while Gagnon, Gaudet, and Usereau prepare for their next steps in hockey, whether in college or the pros.
Bottom LineThe March 21 celebration is not just a tribute to the players but a recognition of their journey and contributions to the team, instilling a strong sense of leadership and culture in the organization. Fans are encouraged to attend and support these athletes as they transition from junior to their next chapters.
Read more at Sagueneens de Chicoutimi

author: La r√©daction avec AFP
title: Football. Les Girondins de Bordeaux renoncent √† leur statut professionnel
text: Football Les Girondins de Bordeaux renoncent √† leur statut professionnel Le club bordelais, rel√©gu√© mardi en National, a annonc√© jeudi qu'il pr√©f√©rait renoncer √† son statut professionnel pour √©viter des sanctions suppl√©mentaires. Les jours se suivent et se ressemblent aux Girondins de Bordeaux. Le club au Scapulaire, [r√©trogad√© en National](/sport/2024/07/23/l2-bordeaux-renonce-a-son-appel-et-retrograde-administrativement-en-national), a renonc√© jeudi au statut professionnel obtenu en 1937. Une d√©cision aux ¬´ cons√©quences funestes ¬ª, selon le maire de la ville [Pierre Hurmic](/p/pierre-hurmic), qui d√©plore notamment la fermeture du centre de formation. Dans un communiqu√© publi√© jeudi soir, le club, qui avait termin√© 12e de Ligue 2 mais a √©t√© sanctionn√© pour ses errements financiers, indique avoir ¬´ d√©pos√© le bilan ¬ª mardi aupr√®s du Tribunal de commerce ¬´ afin d'entamer la restructuration n√©cessaire ¬ª, ce qui aura pour cons√©quence ¬´ tr√®s prochainement ¬ª ¬´ l'ouverture d'une proc√©dure collective qui entra√Ænera automatiquement la perte du statut professionnel du club ¬ª. La crainte de ¬´ sanctions suppl√©mentaires ¬ª La saison de National d√©butant mi-ao√ªt, le club a pr√©f√©r√© ¬´ renoncer √† demander le maintien de son statut professionnel faute de quoi il aurait d√ª se pr√©senter √† nouveau devant la DNCG (Direction nationale du contr√¥le de gestion) avec un budget ne correspondant pas √† (s)a r√©alit√© √† venir (...), ce qui aurait pu le conduire √† des sanctions suppl√©mentaires lourdes ¬ª. Cet ¬´ effort de transparence ¬ª sur ¬´ la situation r√©elle du club ¬ª ¬´ doit notamment permettre de limiter les cons√©quences sportives de cette situation ¬ª, poursuivent les Girondins qui ont ¬´ pour objectif d'√©voluer en National 1 la saison prochaine, pour permettre, au plus vite, le retour du Club, avec des finances assainies et une ambition renouvel√©e, au plus haut niveau ¬ª. Le maire de Bordeaux en col√®re L'√©quipe sextuple championne de France pouvait pourtant esp√©rer conserver le statut professionnel, et donc son centre de formation, si elle √©tait autoris√©e √† repartir en National, division hybride m√™lant clubs pros et amateurs. Mais sa direction, qui esp√®re que le tribunal de commerce privil√©giera le redressement judiciaire √† une liquidation pure et simple, a semble-t-il pr√©f√©r√© faire table rase des contrats en vigueur en raison des difficult√©s du club, qui cherchait 40 millions d'euros pour assainir ses comptes et boucler son budget 2024-2025 en Ligue 2. ¬´ J'apprends avec consternation la d√©cision soudaine autant que personnelle de G√©rard Lopez, a cingl√© Pierre Hurmic dans une d√©claration transmise √† l'AFP. Elle confirme des choix de gestion hasardeux qui ont amen√© en trois saisons notre club qui √©voluait dans l'√©lite de la L1 au niveau amateur. ¬ª La fin de 87 ans chez les professionnels ¬´ L'abandon du statut professionnel aura des cons√©quences funestes avec, en premier lieu, la disparition du centre de formation ¬ª, ajoute le maire √©cologiste, qui affirme ¬´ que d'autres options √©taient et seraient encore possibles pour sauver le club ¬ª. ¬´ Si la gouvernance actuelle n'a plus le ressort, les moyens, l'envie de d√©fendre avec √©nergie la survie de notre club centenaire, patrimoine commun de notre territoire, alors, elle doit en tirer toutes les cons√©quences ¬ª, conclut-il. Cet abandon de statut met un terme √† 87 ann√©es d'appartenance du FC Girondins de Bordeaux au football professionnel fran√ßais et liquide son tr√®s r√©put√© centre de formation, o√π ont notamment √©t√© form√©s les internationaux fran√ßais actuels [Jules Kound√©](/p/jules-kounde) (FC Barcelone) et [Aur√©lien Tchouam√©ni](/p/aurelien-tchouameni) (Real Madrid). Se pose √©galement la question de l'avenir du personnel administratif (90 salari√©s).

author: Sean O'Leary
title: Werenski expected to miss weeks with lower-body injury
text:
Werenski expected to miss weeks with lower-body injury
Columbus Blue Jackets defenseman Zach Werenski is expected to be sidelined week-to-week after an awkward collision with Ondrej Palat forced him out of Wednesday's loss to the New Jersey Devils.
"He's still being evaluated by our docs," Blue Jackets head coach Pascal Vincent said, per
NHL.com. "It's not going to be day-to-day, most likely. I'm sure it's going to be week-to-week now. How many weeks? I don't know."
Werenski leads the Blue Jackets with 25 points this season while also averaging more than 24 minutes per contest. He missed two contests earlier in the year after a knee-on-knee collision and was limited to only 13 games last season due to a shoulder injury.
Columbus drafted Werenski eighth overall in 2015. He's produced 270 points in 450 career games since breaking into the NHL as a 19-year-old.

author: Cristina Tubilla Guerrero
title: Estos errores en tu patinete podr√≠an costarte caro: la DGT no perdona
text:
El uso del patinete el√©ctrico en Espa√±a es cada vez m√°s com√∫n y muchos usuarios lo utilizan sin conocer las normas de tr√°fico, provocando peligro en las v√≠as, accidentes y sanciones econ√≥micas inesperadas.
Leer m√°s: La DGT se vuelca con los adolescentes y lanza esta herramienta Conducir de noche sin el material adecuado, montar despu√©s de una fiesta, usar el m√≥vil o escuchar m√∫sica son algunas de las pr√°cticas que la DGT considera ilegales y que muchas personas realizan sin conocimiento de causa.
Estas normas se aplican a todos los usuarios , tanto lo que utilizan su patinete propio como los que prefieren alquilarlos.
Multas por incumplir estas normas La Direcci√≥n General de Tr√°fico (DGT) establece las siguientes multas a aquellos usuarios que inflijan las normas :
Conducir bajo los efectos del alcohol y otras drogas implica una multa de entre 500 y 1.000 euros. Usar el m√≥vil mientras vas en un patinete el√©ctrico, 200 euros . Ir escuchando m√∫sica con auriculares tambi√©n ser√° multado con la misma cantidad. Montar de noche sin alumbrado o prendas reflectantes , otros 200 euros de sanci√≥n. Conducir un #VMP üõ¥ conlleva la aceptaci√≥n de normas generales, y no cumplirlas es sancionable üëá
üçæBajo los efectos del alcohol y otras drogas ‚û°Ô∏è 500 ‚Äì 1.000 ‚Ç¨.
üì±Usando el #m√≥vil ‚û°Ô∏è 200 ‚Ç¨.
üéµCon auriculares ‚û°Ô∏è 200‚Ç¨.
ü¶∫De noche sin alumbrado o prendas reflectantes ‚û°Ô∏è 200‚Ç¨. pic.twitter.com/OAy2Mw2xfU
‚Äî Dir. Gral. Tr√°fico (@DGTes) August 29, 2024 La misi√≥n de la DGT es prevenir accidentes, ya que consideran que estas pr√°cticas afectan a la seguridad de los usuarios , as√≠ como ser una distracci√≥n para los conductores.

author: Ahmed Farhath, SA News Editor
title: Ulta Beauty stock takes an ugly turn after results and forecast miss
text:
Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:
ULTA) trimmed its forecast for full-year and missed on both revenue and profit consensus for the second quarter.
Shares of the company fell nearly 7% in post-market trading on Thursday. Stock closed +0.2% at $367.58 before the report.
The company now expects 2024 net sales between $11B and $11.2B, from $11.5B to $11.6B previously forecast. The midpoint of the sales range is $11.1B, which is below the consensus estimate of $11.5B.
It also guided earnings per share to $22.60 to $23.50, from $25.20 to $26.00. The midpoint of the new range is $23.05, which is below the $25.06 estimate.
Ulta now expects comparable sales for the year to be negative 2% to 0%, revised from the prior guidance of 2% to 3% growth.
In Q2, comparable sales fell 1.2% vs. the Bloomberg consensus estimate of 1.3% growth. The decline was driven by a 1.8% decrease in transactions and a 0.6% increase in average ticket, the company said.
"While we are encouraged by many positive indicators across our business, our second quarter performance did not meet our expectations, driven primarily by a decline in comparable store sales. We are clear about the factors that adversely impacted our store performance, and we have actions underway to address the trends,‚Äù CEO Dave Kimbell said.
Net income for the three months ended June 30 was $252.6M, compared with $300.1M for the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the company earned $5.30, missing the average analyst expectations by 15 cents.
Revenue rose 4% to $2.6B but missed the consensus mark by $10M.
More on Ulta Beauty

author: Technology Networks
title: Cannabis Alters Brain Function in Youths at Risk for Psychosis
text: Young adults at risk of psychosis show reduced brain connectivity, a deficit that cannabis use appears to worsen, a new study has found. The breakthrough paves the way for psychosis treatments targeting symptoms that current medications miss.In the first-of-its-kind study, McGill University researchers detected a marked decrease in synaptic density‚Äîthe connections between neurons that enable brain communication‚Äîin individuals at risk of psychosis, compared to a healthy control group.‚ÄúNot every cannabis user will develop psychosis, but for some, the risks are high. Our research helps clarify why,‚Äù said, senior author of the study and professor in McGill‚Äôs Department of Psychiatry.‚ÄúCannabis appears to disrupt the brain‚Äôs natural process of refining and pruning synapses, which is essential for healthy brain development.‚ÄùWant more breaking news?Subscribe to Technology Networks‚Äô daily newsletter, delivering breaking science news straight to your inbox every day.Hope for new treatmentsUsing advanced brain scanning technology, the team studied 49 participants aged 16 to 30, including individuals with recent psychotic symptoms and those considered at high risk. The results, published in , indicate that lower synaptic density is linked to social withdrawal and lack of motivation, symptoms the researchers say are difficult to treat.‚ÄúCurrent medications largely target hallucinations, but they don‚Äôt address symptoms that make it difficult to manage social relationships, work, or school,‚Äù said first author Belen Blasco, a PhD student at McGill‚Äôs Integrated Program in Neuroscience. ‚ÄúBy focusing on synaptic density, we may eventually develop therapies that enhance social function and quality of life for those affected.‚ÄùWhile cannabis is a known risk factor for developing psychosis, which can progress to schizophrenia, this is the first time researchers have measured structural changes in the brains of a high-risk population in real time.The team‚Äôs next research phase will explore whether these observed brain changes could predict psychosis development, potentially enabling earlier intervention.Reference: Blasco MB, Nisha Aji K, Ramos-Jim√©nez C, et al. Synaptic density in early stages of psychosis and clinical high risk. JAMA Psychiatry. 2024. doi: This article has been republished from the following . Note: material may have been edited for length and content. For further information, please contact the cited source. Our press release publishing policy can be accessed .

author: FOX 12 Staff
title: Man accused of pouring bleach into Oregon hatchery tank, killing 20K young salmon
text:
DOUGLAS COUNTY, Ore. (KPTV) - A man is accused of pouring a chemical into a rearing pond at an Oregon hatchery, leading to the death of thousands of young salmon.
The investigation began on Monday at the Gardiner, Reedsport, and Winchester Bay (GRWB) Salmon Trout Enhancement Program hatchery. In a Facebook post , the hatchery says a suspect broke in by destroying several door locks and then dumped a gallon of bleach into one of the rearing tanks, killing thousands of smolt Chinook salmon. Oregon State Police reported nearly 18,000 were killed.
‚ÄúThe economic driver of these fish is huge,‚Äù said Deborah Yates, the president of the Gardiner Reedsport Winchester Bay Salmon, Trout Enhancement Program. ‚ÄúThis is not little. It‚Äôs being considered the biggest poaching incident in Oregon history, I think. It‚Äôs monstrous.‚Äù
SEE ALSO: Rural Oregon firefighters rescue cow stuck up to her neck in mud
Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff‚Äôs Office processed the scene and began an investigation.
Then on Tuesday, at about 6:30 p.m., a deputy patrolling the area saw a man walking south along Highway 101, near milepost 210. The sheriff‚Äôs office says the deputy later walked into the hatchery and saw the same man, identified as 22-year-old Joshua Alexander Heckathorn, behind the locked gate and no trespassing signs.
While speaking with the deputy, the sheriff‚Äôs office says Heckathorn admitted to trespassing and handling the chemical bottle on Monday.
Heckathorn was arrested and booked into the Douglas County Jail for second-degree burglary, criminal trespass, and criminal mischief.
‚ÄúPeople care so much that someone hurt these living fish,‚Äù said Yates. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen nature do some horrific things, but never a person. We call it murder‚Ä¶Resulting in the death of 18,000 salmon.‚Äù
Due to the number of smolt chinook salmon that were killed, the sheriff‚Äôs office will be working with the Oregon State Police Fish and Wildlife unit on the case.
‚ÄúSolving this case is the result of collaboration and good policework,‚Äù said Sheriff John Hanlin. ‚ÄúI am proud of the work done by the deputies and have full confidence that the investigation will aid in holding those responsible accountable for their actions.‚Äù
A teenage boy is facing charges after police say he shot at Gresham-Barlow School District buses that were on the way to pick up students. The hatchery says it has three remaining rearing tanks that hold about 60,000 fall Chinook salmon pre-smolt that will be released into Winchester Bay later this spring.
‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs going to live to regret what he did,‚Äù said Yates. ‚ÄúIt just makes no sense.‚Äù
The investigation is ongoing, and no other details have been released at this time.
Copyright 2024 KPTV-KPDX. All rights reserved.

author: Guest
title: Democrats dominated 2023 with wins on abortion rights, labor
text: 2023 was a good year for Democrats and their issues at the ballot box. Virginia put MAGA-allied politicians with higher aspirations, such as Gov. Glenn Youngkin, on notice. Democrats maintained control of the Virginia Senate and regained control of its House control, halting Youngkin's agenda for his final two years in office. That's a victory for Democrats. Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear won an unlikely reelection. This provided Democrats with an interesting snapshot into how to govern and campaign in a progressive way yet connect with a challenging electorate. That's another victory for the left. Two ballot initiative in Ohio favored Democratic positions. The first was a crass attempt by Ohio Republicans to head off a November ballot measure protecting a woman‚Äôs right to choose. By conducting a special election aimed at requiring a supermajority for public ballot measures to become law, this measure challenged both women‚Äôs rights and our democracy. The vote wasn‚Äôt close in what has become a deeply Republican state. People are also reading‚Ä¶ Then on the November ballot, a measure protecting reproductive choice passed by a similar margin. These electoral victories make a difference. Just look at two Midwestern states that used Democratic majorities paired with Democratic governors to gain a range of legislative victories. In Michigan and Minnesota, Democratic control brought gun safety laws, protections for reproductive rights and LGBTQ+ communities, climate-friendly measures and more ability of workers to organize. Labor, a traditional Democratic bloc, repeatedly made gains this past year by standing up, speaking out and winning favorable contracts. Workers already had notched victories at Amazon and Starbucks in 2022. This trend continued in 2023 with the headline-grabbing strikes for writers in the entertainment industry and auto workers. Sometimes victory comes more in the form of problems for your opponents. The year 2023 proved that point for Democrats with a stack of woes for Republicans. It was hard not to see that the Republican Party remains wrapped tightly around the little finger of dictator-in-waiting Donald Trump. His legal woes -- business wrongdoing in New York, the careless handling of sensitive documents, and insurrectionist behavior on a national scale -- contrast nicely for Democrats against their governing and electoral successes. The Republican-controlled House of Representatives provides another contrast with its chaotic and dysfunctional running of the people‚Äôs business. Leadership elections seems pretty straightforward. The party with the most members elects a speaker and goes about its work. Not so with the 2023 Republican House Caucus. It took four days and 15 votes to get Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., as their speaker. Then came a series of bizarre and fruitless political projects including committee hearings, impeachment inquiries and bills with no meaningful results for the people. The one exception was a deal McCarthy finally made on the most basic of functions -- funding the government. But that promptly cost him his job. Did the chaos subside? Well, no. More speaker votes and infighting followed over the next three weeks until Rep. Mike Johnson, R-La., was finally elected speaker. The sum of this very public display of broken and unfit leadership for Republicans can be seen as nothing other than a victory for Democrats. So a quick review of the naughty vs. nice list shows Republicans with a 2023 record filled with dysfunction, contrasting nicely with the Democrats' roster of electoral, legislative and ally victories. Yes, 2023 was a good year for Democrats. Kusler is the national director of Americans for Democratic Action: [adaction.org](https://adaction.org/). He wrote this for [InsideSources.com](http://InsideSources.com).
